dublinCore.dc:title: 119 HR 1676 RH: Make SWAPs Efficient Act of 2025
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Donalds (for himself and Mr. Moskowitz) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Natural Resources
Additional sponsors: Mr. Rutherford, Mr. Diaz-Balart, Mr. Guest, Mr. Scott Franklin of Florida, Mr. Buchanan, Mr. Webster of Florida, Mr. Haridopolos, and Mr. James
Reported with an amendment, committed to the Committee of the Whole House on the State of the Union, and ordered to be printed
action.action-instruction: Strike out all after the enacting clause and insert the part printed in italic
For text of introduced bill, see copy of bill as introduced on February 27, 2025

form.official-title: To amend the Pittman-Robertson Wildlife Restoration Act to require the Secretary of the Interior to approve the wildlife conservation and restoration program of a State within a certain period of time.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Make SWAPs Efficient Act of 2025 or the Make State Wildlife Action Plans Efficient Act of 2025.

section.header: Timing of approval of wildlife conservation and restoration program
section.text: Section 4(e)(3) of the Pittman-Robertson Wildlife Restoration Act (16 U.S.C. 669c(e)(3)) is amended—

paragraph.text: by inserting , not later than 180 days after the date on which the State submitted the comprehensive plan, after , the Secretary;
by striking If the Secretary and inserting
by adding at the end the following:

subparagraph.text: Upon submission of a comprehensive plan by a State under paragraph (1), the Secretary shall conditionally authorize the implementation of the wildlife conservation and restoration program of the State and shall set aside amounts as described in subparagraph (A).

The Secretary, in consultation with the States, shall develop a process to ensure sufficient and timely review of comprehensive plans submitted by States under paragraph (1) and final approval of the wildlife conservation and restoration program of such States not later than 180 days after the date on which a State submits such a comprehensive plan.
It is the intent of Congress that the Secretary prioritize the—

clause.text: timely review of comprehensive plans submitted by States under paragraph (1); and
approval of the wildlife conservation and restoration programs of such States.

subparagraph.text: Not later than June 1 of the year immediately following the year in which a State submits a comprehensive plan under paragraph (1), if the Secretary does not approve the wildlife conservation and restoration program of the State under subparagraph (A) within the time described in that subparagraph, the Secretary shall submit to the Chair and Ranking Member of the Committee on Natural Resources of the House of Representatives and the Environment and Public Works Committee of the Senate a report regarding the status of such comprehensive plan and including the reason why the wildlife conservation and restoration program was not so approved.

endorsement.action-desc: Reported with an amendment, committed to the Committee of the Whole House on the State of the Union, and ordered to be printed
